name: leaderless
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
having no leader or person in charge: His death left the Alliance leaderless at a crucial moment. The team turned out to be a divided, leaderless rabble.
More examplesFewer examplesIt seems likely the bank will remain leaderless for at least a few days.Hundreds of schools are being left leaderless, while many of those that do fill head teacher posts quickly leave. The terrorism that arose in the 1980s came in the form of small cells of just a half a dozen men, creating a leaderless resistance.
